headline: Ask HN: If there is a replacement for email, what should be the requirements?
description:
HN,

Email is one of the most revolutionary internet technologies. However, both in terms of feature amd security, a lot could be done today if it was designed from the ground up instead of pieced together over 30 years.

If you will indulge me and pretend for a moment that I somehow have the power to magically make an email replacement happen and I am asking you to define your requirements, both as technologists and users, what would those requirements be?

Beyond delivering a text message from sender A to reipient B, what are your specific requirements?

Keep in mind, it has to be a passive and somewhat reliable messaging system (i.e.: Not an IRC replacement).
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 如果有电子邮件的替代品，应该有什么要求？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 如果有電子郵件的替代品，應該有什麼要求？
description_zh-Hans:
HN,

电子邮件是最具革命性的互联网技术之一。

如果你允许我假装一下，我有能力神奇地实现电子邮件的替代，我要求你定义你的要求，无论是作为技术专家还是用户，这些要求是什么？

除了将短信从发件人A传递给收件人B之外，您的具体要求是什么？

请记住，它必须是一个被动的、有点可靠的消息传递系统（即：不是IRC的替代品）。
description_zh-Hant:
HN,

電子郵件是最具革命性的互聯網技術之一。

如果你允許我假裝一下，我有能力神奇地實現電子郵件的替代，我要求你定義你的要求，無論是作為技術專家還是用戶，這些要求是什麼？

除了將短信從發件人A傳遞給收件人B之外，您的具體要求是什麼？

請記住，它必須是一個被動的、有點可靠的消息傳遞系統（即：不是IRC的替代品）。
